sen.j: 岸田 劉生（きしだ りゅうせい、男性、1891年6月23日 - 1929年12月20日）は、大正～昭和初期の洋画家。
sen.e: Ryusei KISHIDA (Male, June 23, 1891 - December 20, 1929) was a Western-style painter from the Taisho period to the early Showa period.
Ryusei KISHIDA (Male, June 23, 1891 - December 20, 1929) was a Western-style painter from the Taisho period to the early Showa period.
Ryusei KISHIDA (Male, June 23, 1891 - December 20, 1929) was a Western-style painter from the Taisho period to the early Showa period.

sen.j: 父親はジャーナリストの岸田吟香。
sen.e: His father was Ginko KISHIDA, a journalist.
His father was Ginko KISHIDA, a journalist.
His father was Ginko KISHIDA, a journalist.

sen.j: 明治24年（1908年）、明治の先覚者、岸田吟香の子として東京銀座に生まれる。
sen.e: In 1891, he was born in Ginza, Tokyo as a child of Ginko KISHIDA, a pioneer in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 「明治24年（1908年）」の(1908)は、(1891) の間違いと思われますので、訂正して訳しました。
sen.e: In 1891, he was born in Ginza, Tokyo as a child of Ginko KISHIDA, a pioneer in the Meiji period.
In 1891, he was born in Ginza, Tokyo as a child of Ginko KISHIDA, a pioneer in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 弟はのちに浅草オペラで活躍し宝塚歌劇団の劇作家になる岸田辰彌。
sen.e: His younger brother was Tatsuya KISHIDA, who later took a lively part in Asakusa Opera and became a playwright in Takarazuka Revue.
His younger brother was Tatsuya KISHIDA, who later took a lively part in Asakusa Opera and became a playwright for the Takarazuka Revue.
His younger brother was Tatsuya KISHIDA, who later took a lively part in Asakusa Opera and became a playwright for the Takarazuka Revue.

sen.j: 筑波大学附属中学校・高等学校中退後の明治41年（1908年）、東京の赤坂 (東京都港区)溜池にあった白馬会葵橋洋画研究所に入り黒田清輝に師事した。
sen.e: In 1908 after he left Junior and Senior High School at Otsuka, University of Tsukuba before graduating, he entered Hakuba-kai Aoibashi Yoga-kenkyusho (research institute of oil painting) located at Tameike, Akasaka (Minato Ward, Tokyo) in Tokyo and studied under Seiki KURODA.

In 1908, after he dropped out of the Junior and Senior High School at Otsuka, attached to Tsukuba University, he entered Hakuba-kai Aoibashi Yoga-kenkyusho (research institute of Western-style paintings) located at Tameike, Akasaka (Minato Ward, Tokyo) in Tokyo and studied under Seiki KURODA.
sen.cmt: comma/ wording (as 洋画 is not only oil painting, I changed it)
sen.e: In 1908, after he dropped out of the Junior and Senior High School at Otsuka, attached to Tsukuba University, he entered Hakuba-kai Aoibashi Yoga-kenkyusho (research institute of Western-style paintings) located at Tameike, Akasaka (Minato Ward, Tokyo) in Tokyo and studied under Seiki KURODA.

sen.j: 明治43年（1910年）文展に2点の作品が入選している。
sen.e: In 1910, two of his works were selected for the Bunten exhibition (the annual art exhibition sponsored by the Ministry of Education).
In 1910, prizes were given to two of his works in the Bunten exhibition (the annual art exhibition sponsored by the Ministry of Education).
In 1910, prizes were given to two of his works in the Bunten exhibition (the annual art exhibition sponsored by the Ministry of Education).

sen.j: 明治44年（1911年）『白樺 (雑誌)』主催の美術展がきっかけでバーナード・リーチと知り合い、柳宗悦・武者小路実篤ら『白樺』周辺の文化人とも知り合うようになった。
sen.e: He became acquainted with Bernard LEACH in the wake of an art exhibition sponsored by "Shirakaba" in 1911 and also came to know men of culture relating to "Shirakaba" including Muneyoshi YANAGI and Saneatsu MUSHANOKOJI..

He became acquainted with Bernard Leach through an art exhibition sponsored by the "Shirakaba" magazine in 1911 and also came to know intellectuals relating to "Shirakaba" including Muneyoshi YANAGI and Saneatsu MUSHANOKOJI.
sen.cmt: 一部訳漏れ：（雑誌）wording/ extra period*I am not sure if western family names should also be in all capitals but as the other western family names in this file don't follow this rule, I consolidated.
sen.e: He became acquainted with Bernard Leach through an art exhibition sponsored by the "Shirakaba" magazine in 1911 and also came to know intellectuals relating to "Shirakaba" including Muneyoshi YANAGI and Saneatsu MUSHANOKOJI.

sen.j: 劉生自身も随筆、日記など膨大な文章を残しており、これらは『岸田劉生全集』（10巻、岩波書店、1979年～1980年）にまとめられている。
sen.e: Ryusei himself left a plenty of writings including essays and diaries behind him, which were organized into "Complete works of Ryusei KISHIDA" (Ten volumes, Iwanami Shoten, Publishers, 1979 - 1980).
Ryusei himself left plenty of writings including essays and diaries behind him, which were organized into "Complete works of Ryusei KISHIDA" (Ten volumes, Iwanami Shoten, Publishers, 1979 - 1980).
Ryusei himself left plenty of writings including essays and diaries behind him, which were organized into "Complete works of Ryusei KISHIDA" (Ten volumes, Iwanami Shoten, Publishers, 1979 - 1980).

sen.j: 明治45年（1912年）、高村光太郎・萬鉄五郎（よろずてつごろう）らとともにヒュウザン会を結成、第1回ヒュウザン会展には14点を出品した。
sen.e: In 1912, he organized Hyuzan-kai with Kotaro TAKAMURA, Tetsugoro YOROZU and others, and sent 14 items of his works to the first Hyuzan-kai exhibition.
In 1912, he organized the Hyuzan-kai group with Kotaro TAKAMURA, Tetsugoro YOROZU and others, and sent 14 items of his works to the first Hyuzan-kai exhibition.
In 1912, he organized the Hyuzan-kai group with Kotaro TAKAMURA, Tetsugoro YOROZU and others, and sent 14 items of his works to the first Hyuzan-kai exhibition.

sen.j: これが画壇への本格的なデビューといえる。
sen.e: This was to be his full-scale debut into the art world.
This was to be his full-scale debut into the art world.
This was to be his full-scale debut into the art world.

sen.j: （なお、ヒュウザン会展は2回で終了し、大正2年（1913年）の第2回展ではフュウザン会と改称していた）。
sen.e: (By the way, the second Hyuzan-kai exhibition in 1913 ended up as the last one, of which the name was changed to Hyuzan-kai (different Katakana letter but same pronunciation)).

(In 1913, the Hyuzan-kai exhibition changed its name from 'ヒュウザン会' to 'フュウザン会' [both are pronounced hyuzan-kai but in different spellings] at the second exhibition and with the former name, there were only two exhibitions held).

(In 1913, the Hyuzan-kai exhibition changed its name from 'ヒュウザン会' to 'フュウザン会' [both are pronounced hyuzan-kai but in different spellings] at the second exhibition and with the former name, there were only two exhibitions held).

sen.j: 劉生の初期の作品はポスト印象派、特にポール・セザンヌの影響が強い。
sen.e: Ryusei's early works were strongly influenced by the Postimpressionists, more especially, Paul Cézanne.
Ryusei's early works were strongly influenced by the Postimpressionists, especially Paul Cézanne.
Ryusei's early works were strongly influenced by the Postimpressionists, especially Paul Cézanne.

sen.j: この頃からヨーロッパのルネサンスやバロックの巨匠、特にアルブレヒト・デューラーの影響が顕著な写実的作風に移っていく。
sen.e: Around this time on, his idiom was changing to realistic one remarkably influenced by the great masters of European Renaissance and Baroque, more especially, Albrecht Dürer.
Around this time on, his idiom was changing to a realistic one remarkably influenced by the great masters of the European Renaissance and Baroque, especially Albrecht Dürer.
Around this time on, his idiom was changing to a realistic one remarkably influenced by the great masters of the European Renaissance and Baroque, especially Albrecht Dürer.

sen.j: 大正4年（1915年）、現代の美術社主催第1回美術展（第2回展以降の名称は「草土社展」）に出品する。
sen.e: In 1915, he sent his work to the first exhibition (The name of the exhibition was changed to 'Sodosha-ten' for the second exhibition and after) sponsored by Gendai no bijutsu sha.
In 1915, he sent his work to the first exhibition (the name of the exhibition was changed to 'Sodosha-ten' for the second exhibition and after) sponsored by 'Gendai no Bijutsusha' company.
In 1915, he sent his work to the first exhibition (the name of the exhibition was changed to 'Sodosha-ten' for the second exhibition and after) sponsored by 'Gendai no Bijutsusha' company.

sen.j: 草土社のメンバーは木村荘八・清宮彬・中川一政らであった。
sen.e: The members of the Sodosha included Shohachi KIMURA, Hitoshi SEIMIYA and Kazumasa NAKAGAWA.
The members of the Sodosha group included Shohachi KIMURA, Hitoshi SEIMIYA and Kazumasa NAKAGAWA.
The members of the Sodosha group included Shohachi KIMURA, Hitoshi SEIMIYA and Kazumasa NAKAGAWA.

sen.j: 草土社は大正11年（1922年）までに9回の展覧会を開き、劉生はそのすべてに出品している。
sen.e: Sodosha held nine exhibitions by 1922, of which Ryusei sent his works to all.
Sodosha held nine exhibitions by 1922, of which Ryusei sent his works to all.
Sodosha held nine exhibitions by 1922, of which Ryusei sent his works to all.

sen.j: 大正4年に描かれ、翌年の第2回草土社展に出品された『切通しの写生（道路と土手と塀）』は劉生の風景画の代表作の一つである。
sen.e: One of the representative works of landscape painting of Ryusei was "Road Cut through a Hill" which was completed in 1915 and sent to the second Sodosha-ten in the next year.
sen.cmt: 東京国立近代美術館サイトhttp://search.artmuseums.go.jp/records.php?sakuhin=5368の表現に統一いたします。「道路と土手と(切通之写生)」＝「Road Cut through a Hill」
sen.e: One of the representative works of landscape painting of Ryusei was "Road Cut through a Hill" which was completed in 1915 and sent to the second Sodosha-ten in the next year.
One of the representative works of landscape painting of Ryusei was "Road Cut through a Hill" which was completed in 1915 and sent to the second Sodosha-ten in the next year.

sen.j: 大正6年（1917年）、結核を疑われ、友人武者小路実篤の住んでいた神奈川県藤沢町鵠沼の貸別荘に転地療養の目的で居住（結核は誤診だといわれる）。
sen.e: In 1917, on suspicion of tuberculosis, he moved for a change of air to a rental villa in Kugenuma, Fujisawa-cho, Kanagawa Prefecture where his friend, Saneatsu MUSHANOKOJI lived (It is said that tuberculosis was a mistaken diagnosis.

In 1917, on suspicion of tuberculosis, he moved for a change of air to a rental villa in Kugenuma, Fujisawa-cho, Kanagawa Prefecture where his friend, Saneatsu MUSHANOKOJI, lived (it is said that tuberculosis was a mistaken diagnosis).
sen.cmt: I added ")" both in japanese and english sentenceslower case/ comma
sen.e: In 1917, on suspicion of tuberculosis, he moved for a change of air to a rental villa in Kugenuma, Fujisawa-cho, Kanagawa Prefecture where his friend, Saneatsu MUSHANOKOJI, lived (it is said that tuberculosis was a mistaken diagnosis).

sen.j: 庭に土俵を設け、来客と相撲に興じた。
sen.e: He prepared a Dohyo (Sumo ring) in the garden, where he enjoyed Sumo with his guests).
He prepared a Dohyo (Sumo ring) in the garden, where he enjoyed Sumo with his guests.
sen.cmt: I took out ")" both in japanese and english sentences.
sen.e: He prepared a Dohyo (Sumo ring) in the garden, where he enjoyed Sumo with his guests.

sen.j: 大正7年（1918年）頃から娘の岸田麗子（1914年～1962年）の肖像を描くようになる。
sen.e: From around 1918, he came to paint portraits of his daughter, Reiko KISHIDA (1914 - 1962).
From around 1918, he came to paint portraits of his daughter, Reiko KISHIDA (1914 - 1962).
From around 1918, he came to paint portraits of his daughter, Reiko KISHIDA (1914 - 1962).

sen.j: 大正9年（1920年）、30歳になったことを期に日記をつけはじめ、没後刊行された。
sen.e: He used his turning thirty in 1920 as the occasion for starting to keep a diary, which was published after his death.
He used his turning thirty in 1920 as the occasion for starting to keep a diary, which was published after his death.
He used his turning thirty in 1920 as the occasion for starting to keep a diary, which was published after his death.

sen.j: これにより、幅広い交友関係が窺われる。
sen.e: His broad relationships may be gathered from the above.
His broad relationships may be gathered from the above.
His broad relationships may be gathered from the above.

sen.j: 劉生を慕って草土社の椿貞雄や横堀角次郎も鵠沼に住むようになり、中川一政らのように岸田家の食客となる若者もいた。
sen.e: Sadao TSUBAKI and Kakujiro YOKOHORI of Sodosha moved to Kugenuma due to their respect for Ryusei and there were young men including Kazumasa NAKAGAWA, who lived in Kishida family's house without paying.

Sadao TSUBAKI and Kakujiro YOKOBORI of Sodosha moved to Kugenuma due to their respect for Ryusei and there were young men, including Kazumasa NAKAGAWA, who lived in the Kishida family's house without paying.
sen.cmt: comma/ artilce/ pronunciation corrected (横堀角次郎): http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%A8%AA%E5%A0%80%E8%A7%92%E6%AC%A1%E9%83%8E
sen.e: Sadao TSUBAKI and Kakujiro YOKOBORI of Sodosha moved to Kugenuma due to their respect for Ryusei and there were young men, including Kazumasa NAKAGAWA, who lived in the Kishida family's house without paying.

sen.j: 大正12年（1923年）、関東大震災で自宅が倒壊し、京都に転居し、後に鎌倉に移る。
sen.e: In 1923, his house was destroyed in the Great Kanto Earthquake and he moved to Kyoto, but later moved to Kamakura.
In 1923, his house was destroyed in the Great Kanto Earthquake and he moved to Kyoto, but later moved to Kamakura.
In 1923, his house was destroyed in the Great Kanto Earthquake and he moved to Kyoto, but later moved to Kamakura.

sen.j: この鵠沼時代がいわば岸田劉生の最盛期であった。
sen.e: His days in Kugenuma was, so to speak, the golden age of Ryusei KISHIDA.
His days in Kugenuma were, so to speak, the golden age of Ryusei KISHIDA.
His days in Kugenuma were, so to speak, the golden age of Ryusei KISHIDA.

sen.j: 劉生の京都移住に伴い、草土社は自然解散の形になったが、劉生を含めメンバーの多くは春陽会に活動の場を移した。
sen.e: Although Sodosha was automatically wound up following Ryusei's move to Kyoto, many of the members including Ryusei changed their stage of activities to the Shunyo-kai Art Society.
Although Sodosha was automatically concluded following Ryusei's move to Kyoto, many of the members including Ryusei changed their stage of activities to the Shunyo-kai Art Society.
Although Sodosha was automatically concluded following Ryusei's move to Kyoto, many of the members including Ryusei changed their stage of activities to the Shunyo-kai Art Society.

sen.j: 昭和4年（1929年）、南満州鉄道（満鉄）の招きで生涯ただ一度の海外旅行に出かけ、大連市・奉天・ハルビンなどに滞在する。
sen.e: In 1929, at the invitation of South Manchuria Railways (Mantetsu), he made his only trip abroad in his life staying Dalian City, Hoten (Fengtian), Harbin and so on.
In 1929, at the invitation of South Manchuria Railways (Mantetsu), he made his only trip abroad in his life staying in Dalian City, Hoten (Fengtian), Harbin and other places.
In 1929, at the invitation of South Manchuria Railways (Mantetsu), he made his only trip abroad in his life staying in Dalian City, Hoten (Fengtian), Harbin and other places.

sen.j: 帰国直後、滞在先の山口県徳山（現・周南市）で尿毒症のため死去する。
sen.e: Immediately after his return to Japan, he died of urine poisoning in Tokuyama, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present Shunan City) where he was then staying.
Immediately after his return to Japan, he died of urine poisoning in Tokuyama, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present Shunan City) where he was then staying.
Immediately after his return to Japan, he died of urine poisoning in Tokuyama, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present Shunan City) where he was then staying.

sen.j: 38歳であった。
sen.e: He was 38 years old.
He was 38 years old.
He was 38 years old.

sen.j: 墓所は多磨霊園。
sen.e: His tomb is in the Tama Cemetery.
His tomb is in the Tama Cemetery.
His tomb is in the Tama Cemetery.

sen.j: 「道路と土手と塀（切通之写生）」（1915年、東京国立近代美術館）（重要文化財）
sen.e: 'Road Cut through a Hill' (1915, The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo) (Important Cultural Property)

sen.j: 「壺の上に林檎が載って在る」（1916年、東京国立近代美術館）
sen.e: 'An Apple Exists on Top of a Pot' (1916, The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo)

sen.j: 「麗子肖像（麗子五歳之像）」（1918年、東京国立近代美術館）
sen.e: 'Reiko, Five Years Old' (1918, The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo)

sen.e: 'Smiling Reiko' (1921, Tokyo National Museum) (Important Cultural Property)
